home.pageHeader: Get access with a certificate on paper
home.pageIntro:
Here's how it works

Your and other people’s health matters. That is why some countries and places ask for a coronavirus pass. You’re only allowed to enter carrying this pass.

A certificate on paper is convenient if you don't have a smartphone.
home.userConsentHeader: Start making a certificate on paper
home.userConsentText: I have read the privacy statement and understand how CoronaCheck processes my data.
home.noConsentError: Give consent to the privacy statement first
home.pageBody:
Certificate of test or vaccination

You can make a coronavirus pass with CoronaCheck if:

  • you have been vaccinated
  • a test result confirms you don’t have corona
  • you've had coronavirus and are recovered

QR code = your proof

CoronaCheck generates a QR code with your vaccination, test result or recovery. That is your certificate. This QR code will be checked before you get access.

QR codes for the Netherlands and international

This app generates QR codes for the Netherlands and abroad. Travelling outside of the Netherlands? Then use your international QR code.
home.pageBody1G:
Dutch certificate for 1G access

Visiting a place in the Netherlands where a coronavirus pass is required to enter? You only get access with a test certificate (1G access). You can create this if you have a negative coronavirus test.

International certificate for abroad

Are you abroad or crossing the border? Then you need an international certificate. You can create this if:

  • You have been vaccinated
  • You have tested positive and have recovered from coronavirus
  • You have tested negative and don’t have coronavirus

About your data

The privacy statement states the way CoronaCheck handles your data.
home.pageIntro0G:
Here's how it works

Your health matters, and so does the health of others. That is why some countries require a coronavirus pass. For example at the border, or at certain places and activities. A certificate on paper is convenient if you don't have a smartphone.
home.pageBody0G:
Travel safely with a certificate

Travelling to a country where a coronavirus pass is required? Then you need an international certificate. You can create this if:

  • You are vaccinated
  • You have tested positive and have recovered from coronavirus
  • You have tested negative and don’t have coronavirus

Your certificate contains a QR code

The QR code on your certificate can be checked at the entrance to places and activities abroad. Or at the border.

About your data

The privacy statement states the way CoronaCheck handles your data.

choiceProof.pageHeader: What certificate do you want to make?
choiceProof.choiceTestBody: The test proves I do not have coronavirus
choiceProof.choiceRecoveryBody: The test proves I have had coronavirus

choiceTestLocation.pageIntro: Does the test point out you don't have coronavirus? Then you can use the negative test result to create a certificate. Please specify where you were tested.
choiceTestLocation.didNotGetTestedYet: I have not been tested yet

collectVaccination.pageIntro: Did you receive a (booster) vaccination? Log in using DigiD to retrieve all your vaccination details.

vaccinationOverview.pageIntro: Check your details below. If these are correct you can create a certificate.

vaccinationsNone.pageIntro:
There is no available vaccination data. This can have various causes. Read the Guidepost for more information.

Got vaccinated recently? It can take a few hours until your details are available. Try again later.

notPossibleVaccinations.pageIntro: At the moment, we cannot provide proof of your vaccination. This can have different causes. Learn more about possible causes.

vaccinationsIncomplete.pageIntro: At this moment, we can’t make a certificate. For a Dutch certificate you need to be fully vaccinated.

collectRecovery.pageIntro: Have you had coronavirus? Then you can make a recovery certificate of the positive test result. Log in with DigiD to retrieve your test result.

provideCode.pageIntro: Enter your retrieval code. You received it from your test location.
provideCode.verificationCodeDirection: You get a code via text or email
provideCode.emptyTestCode: Please enter a retrieval code first
provideCode.unknownTestProvider: This code is invalid. A valid code looks like this: BRB-YYYYYYYYY1-Z2.
provideCode.invalidTestCode: This code is invalid. A valid code looks like this: BRB-YYYYYYYYY1-Z2.
provideCode.invalidVerificationCode: Invalid combination. Enter the 6-digit verification code.
provideCode.emptyVerificationCode: Please enter a verification code first
provideCode.resultBlocked: You’ve tried to enter an invalid code too many times. Please try again in 5 minutes.

negativeTestOverview.pageIntro: This test result is retrieved from the test location. If the details are correct, you can create a certificate.

testResultPending.pageIntro:
Please try again later.
If you have any questions, contact your test location.

testResultNone.pageIntro: There is no negative test result available.

recoveryOverview.pageIntro: Check your details below. If these are correct you can create a certificate.

recoveryExpired.pageHeader: Positive test result no longer valid
recoveryExpired.pageIntro:
It has been too long ago since you tested positive for coronavirus. Therefore, your test result is no longer valid. Unfortunately, you cannot create a recovery certificate.

Find more information on the Guidepost.

recoveryNone.pageIntro:
Have you just been tested? It may take a few hours before your result is available. Please try again later.

Were you tested longer ago at the GGD? Then please contact the GGD's backoffice on 0800-5090 to verify if your details were entered into the system correctly.

Were you tested longer ago at another location? Then please fill out the application form coronavirus recovery pass for people who weren't tested at the GGD.

recoveryInvalid.pageHeader: Positive test result is not suitable
recoveryInvalid.pageIntro:
You were tested positive after your first vaccination. Your test result is therefore not suitable for creating a Dutch certificate.

Check the frequently asked questions for more information.

pageHeader.domestic: Success! Your certificate is ready below
pageHeader.european: Success! Your certificate is ready below
pageHeader.both: Success! Your certificates are ready below

pageIntro.domestic:
You only have a %{type} certificate for use in the Netherlands. You can use it to access places or activities within the Netherlands, but not when you’re travelling abroad or crossing the border.

Open the PDF and print it. Take your printed certificate to the place or activity you’re visiting.
pageIntro.european:
You only have an international %{type} certificate. You can use this if you are abroad or crossing the border, but not within the Netherlands.

Open the PDF and print it. Take your printed certificate to the country you're traveling to.
pageIntro.both:
You have a Dutch and an international %{type} certificate. Are you crossing the border, or are you abroad right now? Then please use the international certificate.

Open the PDFs and print them. Take your printed certificate to the place or activity you’re visiting. Or to the country you’re traveling to.
pageIntro.bothVaccinationRecovery:
You have a Dutch and an international certificate. Are you crossing the border, or are you abroad right now? Then please use the international certificate.

Open the PDFs and print them. Take your printed certificate to the place or activity you’re visiting. Or to the country you’re traveling to.
pageIntro.short-stay: You have a visitor pass for use in the Netherlands. Open the PDF and print it. Take your printed certificate to the place or activity you’re visiting.
pageIntro.0G:
You have created an international %{type} certificate. Always check before departure if you have the right certificate on Netherlands Worldwide.

Open the PDF and print it. Take your printed certificate to the country you’re traveling to.

print.validInFuture: Please note: your recovery certificate will become valid 11 days after the positive test result. You need to be free of symptoms as well.

validPeriod.summary: How long is my paper certificate valid for?
validPeriod.content: This paper certificate is valid for 1 year. After that, you can create a new paper certificate of your vaccination.

validLocation.summary: Where can I use my international certificate?
validLocation.content: The validity of corona certificates differs per country. Before leaving, please check which certificate you need for your destination at Netherlands Worldwide.

whyNoDomesticVaccination.summary: Why didn’t I receive a Dutch vaccination certificate?
whyNoDomesticVaccination.content: Your vaccination(s) unfortunately don't entitle you to a Dutch vaccination certificate. For possible reasons check this page about the requirements and validity of the vaccination certificate.

whyNoDutchCertificate.summary: Had coronavirus before your first vaccination?
whyNoDutchCertificate.content: Then you're normally considered fully vaccinated with one vaccination. Retrieve your positive test result to add this to your vaccination certificate.
whyNoDutchCertificate.label: Retrieve my test result

whyNoEuropeanRecovery.summary: Why didn’t I receive an international recovery certificate?
whyNoEuropeanRecovery.content: Your recovery certificate isn't valid internationally. The reason for this could be that the type of test is not accepted, or that the test is no longer valid abroad. An international recovery certificate can only be made with a PCR-test that is less than 180 days old. Read more about the possible causes on the Guidepost.

whyNoEuropeanTest.summary: Why didn’t I receive an international test certificate?
whyNoEuropeanTest.content: You may not have received an international test certificate because your type of test isn’t accepted abroad. Get tested again for a certificate that is also valid abroad.

whyNoDomesticTest.summary: Why don’t I get a Dutch test certificate?
whyNoDomesticTest.content: You may not have received a Dutch test certificate because the validity period of a test may be shorter in the Netherlands than in other countries. Get tested again for a certificate that is also valid in the Netherlands.

shortStay.summary: How long is my certificate valid?
shortStay.content: A visitor pass is valid up until 14 days after review of your vaccination. Are you staying in the Netherlands longer? Then you can request a visitor pass again. For more information, please visit www.government.nl/entry-pass-visitors.

whyNoDomesticVaccination1G.summary: Why didn’t I receive a Dutch vaccination certificate?
whyNoDomesticVaccination1G.content: Currently, in the Netherlands the coronavirus entry pass is only used in places you can only enter with a test certificate (1G access). A vaccination certificate is not needed for access within the Netherlands. Read more on this government page about the measures.

whyNoDomesticRecovery1G.summary: Why didn’t I receive a Dutch recovery certificate?
whyNoDomesticRecovery1G.content: Currently, in the Netherlands the coronavirus entry pass is only used in places you can only enter with a test certificate (1G access). A recovery certificate is not needed for access within the Netherlands. Read more on this government page about the measures.

whyNoDomesticTest1G.summary: Where can I use my Dutch certificate?
whyNoDomesticTest1G.content: A test certificate is valid anywhere in the Netherlands where you are asked for a coronavirus entry pass (1G access).

errorNoEvents.pageHeader: Sorry, your details were not retrieved
errorNoEvents.pageIntro:
Due to increased traffic or an outage at one of the involved parties, some details of your %{type} may be missing.

Tip: wait one hour and try again.

errorTokenFlow.pageIntro:
Something is going wrong at the test location. Therefore, your details can’t be retrieved.

What now?

Contact the test location and give them the following error code:

errorDigiD.pageIntro: There was an error while communicating with DigiD. Please try again later. If the error persists, please check www.digid.nl/en for the latest information.

errorGeneral.pageIntro: Something went wrong while creating your certificate. Can you try again later?
errorGeneral.label: Error code | Error codes

errorNoBsn.pageIntro: The healthcare provider who vaccinated or tested you can help you further. Contact them and let them know CoronaCheck couldn’t find a social security number.

errorSessionExpired.pageIntro: You’ve waited too long. For safety reasons, you were logged out. Log in again with your DigiD to retrieve your details.

errorProofNotPossible.pageIntro:
At this moment, we can't make a certificate. This can have various causes. Read more on the Guidepost.

Error code
%{error}

shortStay.pageIntro:
Were you vaccinated outside of the European Union, and are you visiting the Netherlands? Then you can use your vaccination approval and negative test result to create a visitor pass.

You can use your visitor pass to get access to places and activities in the Netherlands that require a coronavirus pass. For more information, please visit www.government.nl/entry-pass-visitors.

Please keep your approval code from the desk that reviewed your vaccination at hand. The same goes for the retrieval code you've received from the test location.

shortStayProvideAssessmentCode.pageIntro: Enter your approval code. You received this code from the desk that reviewed your vaccination.
shortStayProvideAssessmentCode.verificationCodeDirection: You get a code via text or email
shortStayProvideAssessmentCode.emptyTestCode: Please enter an approval code first
shortStayProvideAssessmentCode.unknownTestProvider: This code is invalid. A valid code looks like this: VAC-YYYYYYYYY1-F2.
shortStayProvideAssessmentCode.invalidTestCode: This code is invalid. A valid code looks like this: VAC-YYYYYYYYY1-F2.
shortStayProvideAssessmentCode.invalidVerificationCode: Invalid combination. Enter the 6-digit verification code.
shortStayProvideAssessmentCode.emptyVerificationCode: Please enter a verification code first

shortStayNoAssessmentCode.pageIntro: You've just entered the retrieval code of your test result. Please enter your approval code first to retrieve your vaccination approval. You've received this code either by email or on paper from the desk that reviewed your vaccination.

short-stay.pageIntro: If the details are correct you can create a visitor pass.

errorCode99552.pageHeader: Sorry, we cannot create a certificate
errorCode99552.pageIntro:
The personal details on your vaccination approval and your negative test result do not match. As a result, we cannot create a visitor pass.

Please check which details are incorrect. Then please speak to the desk that reviewed your vaccination or contact your test location. They can help you change these details.

browserNotSupported.pageIntro:
The internet browser you are using is too old to load this page. Please download a newer browser. For example:

Google Chrome

Mozilla Firefox

Microsoft Edge
browserNotSupported.button: Back to the homepage of CoronaCheck.nl

errorCodeSaml.pageIntro: An error has occurred while communicating with DigiD. Please try again later. If this error persists, please check https://www.digid.nl/en for the latest information.

proofIntroduction.pageIntro:
If your vaccination is missing, it will not be included in the vaccination certificate you want to create. Do you already have a certificate with QR code of your missing vaccination? Then you can add it in the next step.

You can add a certificate with QR code of your vaccination from abroad. Or a certificate you received from your health care provider or the Dutch government.
proofIntroduction.link: Don’t have a certificate with QR code?

letterCombination.pageIntro: With your certificate you received a separate paper with a letter combination. Enter this letter combination below to add your missing vaccination.
letterCombination.emptyCode: Please enter a letter combination first
letterCombination.invalidCode: This letter combination is invalid. A valid combination looks like this: FLBRXQ.
letterCombination.rejectedCode: This letter combination is invalid. A valid combination looks like this: FLBRXQ.

letterCombinationInvalid.pageIntro:
This letter combination and the certificate you want to add do not belong together. Find the correct letter combination and certificate and try again.

Not working? Then you can still create a certificate from the vaccinations you retrieved with DigiD.

noLetterCombination.pageIntro:
You only have a letter combination if you requested your certificate at a healthcare provider, for example your GP. Or if you received it from the Dutch government by post.

Don't have a letter combination or lost it? Unfortunately, it is not possible to add your vaccination now. First, request a new certificate with letter combination at your health care provider or the Dutch government.

Want to create a certificate now anyway? Continue with the vaccinations you retrieved via DigiD.

chooseAddProofQR.pageHeader: How do you want to add?
chooseAddProofQR.pageIntro: If your device has a camera, you can scan the QR code on your certificate. Or add your certificate as a file.

chooseNoneQR.pageHeader: No certificate with QR code of missing vaccination
chooseNoneQR.body: Want to create a certificate now anyway? Continue with the vaccinations you retrieved via DigiD.

proofsOverviewList.pageIntro: Continue to add these vaccinations to your certificate. Or add another vaccination.

uploadFileQR.pageIntro: You can add a file with one or more QR codes from a folder, or drag and drop it into the box below. Make sure the file type is {acceptFileExtensions}.

cameraQR.pageHeader: Hold the QR code on your certificate in front of the camera
cameraQR.pageIntro: Make sure the entire QR code is visible. Do you have multiple QR codes? Then you can add these in the same way later.

noQRCodeFound.pageIntro: No QR code was found to add your missing vaccination. Take another picture or add another file, showing the QR code clearly.

errorQRInvalid.pageIntro: The QR code you are trying to add is not recognised as a coronavirus pass. Check if you have the correct QR code.

errorQRDomestic.pageIntro: You don’t need to add your Dutch QR code. Add the QR code on the international certificate you received from your health care provider or the government. It contains the information needed to add your missing vaccination. You can recognise this certificate by the European flag.

errorQRInvalidType.pageIntro: The QR code you are trying to add does not belong to a vaccination certificate. You can only add a certificate of your vaccination.

errorQRDuplicate.pageHeader: This QR code has already been added
errorQRDuplicate.pageIntro: You’ve already added this QR code. Try adding another QR code.

errorQRMismatch.pageIntro:
The personal details on the certificate you are trying to add differ from the details you retrieved with DigiD. Because of that, you can’t add this certificate.

Please check if the date of birth is correct, and if your name is written as in your passport.

Is something wrong? Please have your details updated at the place where you received this vaccination.

chooseCareProvider.pageHeader: Request your certificate from your healthcare provider
chooseCareProvider.pageIntro: Please contact the care provider who vaccinated you. Here you can request your certificate on paper or as a PDF file.

chooseTestProvider.pageIntro: Is your result in? Log in with DigiD to retrieve your test result from the GGD.

chooseNoDigiD.pageIntro: Are you living in the Netherlands and do you have a Dutch proof of identity? Then you can request a DigiD to retrieve your test result or vaccination details.

chooseBSN.pageHeader: Do you have a Dutch citizen service number (BSN)?
chooseBSN.pageIntro: With your BSN, you can request your certificate at the CoronaCheck helpdesk. Don’t have a BSN? Then you can get a certificate from your test or vaccination location.

requestDigid.pageHeader: Request your certificate via the helpdesk
requestDigid.pageIntro:
Request your certificate at the CoronaCheck helpdesk. You can call them every day between 8AM and 8PM at: 0800-1421 (free). Or if you’re calling from abroad: +31 70 750 37 20. In the menu you can choose “request a certificate”.

Please provide the following:

  • your citizen service number (BSN)
  • your zipcode

Your certificate with QR code will be sent by post. This can take up to 7 working days.

proofAddedOverviewList.link: I want to add another vaccination
proofAddedOverviewList.pageIntro: Continue to add these vaccinations to your certificate. Or add another vaccination.

errorQRValidateFuzzyMatchFailed.pageIntro:
The personal details on the certificate you are trying to add differ from the details you retrieved with DigiD. Because of that, you can’t add this certificate.

Please check if the date of birth is correct, and if you name is written as in your passport.

Is something wrong? Please have your details updated at the place where you received this vaccination.

errorQRValidateMissingHolderNames.pageIntro: Try to add a valid QR code, or contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk via 0800-1421 and give them the following error code.

errorQRValidateInvalidDCC.pageHeader: QR code has been declared invalid
errorQRValidateInvalidDCC.pageIntro: The QR code you are trying to scan has been declared invalid. Try to add a valid QR code, or contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk via 0800-1421 and give them the following error code.

errorQRValidateBlockedDCC.pageHeader: QR code has been declared invalid
errorQRValidateBlockedDCC.pageIntro: The QR code you are trying to scan has been declared invalid and is therefore blocked. Try to add a valid QR code, or contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk via 0800-1421 and give them the following error code.

errorQRValidateUnknownError.pageIntro: Try to add a valid QR code, or contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk via 0800-1421 and give them the following error code.

domestic.title: Dutch certificate
domestic.intro: Use this certificate to access places or activities within the Netherlands.

european.title: International certificate
european.intro: Use this certificate if you are abroad or crossing the border.

modal.head: Do you want to switch to English?
modal.body: Switching languages will return you to the first page and restart the process of creating a paper certificate.

recently-vaccinated.content:
Then it may take a while to retrieve your data and create a certificate. Please try again later.

Is your vaccination still missing after a few days? Please contact the health care provider where you were vaccinated. This can be the GGD, your GP or another health care provider. They can help you adjust your data.

no-qr.summary: Do you have a vaccination certificate, but without QR code?
no-qr.content:
You can only add a missing vaccination if you already have the certificate with QR code of that vaccination. This can be a certificate of a foreign vaccination you have on paper, or in a foreign coronavirus app. You can also add a paper certificate you received from your health care provider or the Dutch government.

For more information, visit government.nl/covid-certificate.

preferMobile.header: Prefer having your certificate on mobile?
preferMobile.intro: Then download the app. You can also make a print of the certificate in the app.

info.detailsRetrieved: The following details were retrieved at the test location
The following details of your vaccination have been retrieved at %{provider}
info.finalDosis: Is this the last dose of your vaccination?

about.head: Are these details incorrect?
about.body: Please go back to the desk that reviewed your vaccination. They can help you change your details.

info.head: Are these details incorrect?
info.body: Please contact the test location. They can help you change your details.

vaccination.title: Did you have coronavirus?
vaccination.body: In some cases, you need one less vaccination to be fully vaccinated. Retrieve your oldest positive test result as well to possibly have it count for your vaccination certificate.
vaccination.checkbox: Yes, retrieve my positive test result too

vaccination.head: Is something wrong?
vaccination.body: Please contact the care provider who vaccinated you. This can be the GGD, your general practitioner, or a doctor belonging to a healthcare facility. They can help you change these details.

negativetest.head: Is something wrong?
negativetest.body: Please contact the test location. They can help you change your details.

positivetest.head: Is something wrong?
positivetest.body: Please contact the test location. They can help you change your details.

vaccinationWithPositiveTest.head: Is something wrong?
vaccinationWithPositiveTest.body: Please contact the care provider who vaccinated or tested you. This can be the GGD, your general practitioner, or a doctor belonging to a healthcare facility. They can help you change these details.

noVerificationCode.head: Didn’t receive a verification code?
noVerificationCode.body: TYou receive the verification code via text or email. Didn't get one? Click ‘send again’ below for a new code.

didNotGetTestedYet.head: I haven’t been tested yet
didNotGetTestedYet.body:
For a test certificate, you must take a test first at an affiliated test location. Does the test prove you don't have coronavirus? Then you can make a certificate.

Make an appointment

areYouSureToCancel.head: Are you sure you want to stop?
areYouSureToCancel.body: Then you will have to retrieve your details again later.

digidCanceled.head: Login was cancelled
digidCanceled.body: Want to retrieve your %{type}? Log in again with DigiD.

digidFinished.body: We'll retrieve your %{type}. You will be logged out of DigiD automatically

sessionEnded.head: Your session has ended
sessionEnded.body: For safety, your session will automatically stop after 24 hours.

loginCanceled.body: Couldn’t retrieve your %{type}. Please try again to arrange your certificate via the GGD.
loginCanceled.head: Retrieval cancelled

general.head: Sorry, something went wrong
general.body: Because of a technical error. Contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk.

noInternet.head: You're not connected to the internet
noInternet.body: Check your connection and try again.

collectEventsWithErrors.head: Are these all your vaccinations?
collectEventsWithErrors.body: Due to increased traffic or an outage, some of your details may be missing. Are you missing a vaccination? Please come back later and retrieve your details again.

tooBusy: It's very busy right now, and therefore you cannot log in at the moment. Could you please try again later?

warning.noPositivetest: No positive test result that could count for your vaccination certificate was found.

error.not-started: Something went wrong when starting the camera

states.REJECTED: You must first give permission to use your camera.

route.title: Scan certificate with camera
route.description: I can show my certificate in front of my device’s camera

route.title: Add certificate as a file
route.description: I have a file or picture of my certificate on my device

unsupported.title: Choose a different file type
unsupported.body: You can only add {acceptFileExtensions}files. Choose one of these file types.

duplicate.title: This QR code has already been scanned
duplicate.body: You have already scanned this QR code. Try scanning another QR code.

domestic.title: Scan your international QR code
domestic.body: You don’t need to scan your Dutch QR code. Scan the QR code on the international certificate you received from your health care provider or the government. It contains the information needed to add your missing vaccination. You can recognise this certificate by the European flag.

invalid.title: QR code not recognised
invalid.body: The QR code you are trying to scan is not recognised as a coronavirus pass. Check if you’re holding the correct QR code in front of the camera.

invalidType.title: Scan your vaccination certificate
invalidType.body: The QR code you are trying to scan does not belong to a vaccination certificate. You can only add a certificate of your vaccination.

no-camera.title: No camera found
no-camera.body: Make sure your camera is connected and installed on your device. Or choose to add your certificate as a file.

mismatch.title: The personal details don’t match
mismatch.body: The personal details on the certificate you are trying to scan differ from the details you retrieved with DigiD. Because of that, you can’t add this certificate.

errorQRValidateFuzzyMatchFailed.body: The personal details on the certificate you are trying to scan differ from the details you retrieved with DigiD. Because of that, you can’t add this certificate.
errorQRValidateFuzzyMatchFailed.title: The personal details don’t match

errorQRValidateMissingHolderNames.body: Try to add a valid QR code, or contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk via 0800-1421 and give them the following error code.
errorQRValidateMissingHolderNames.title: Sorry, something went wrong

errorQRValidateInvalidDCC.body: The QR code you are trying to scan has been declared invalid. That's why you can't add it. Try to add a valid QR code, or contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk via 0800-1421 and give them the following error code.
errorQRValidateInvalidDCC.title: QR code has been declared invalid

errorQRValidateBlockedDCC.body: The QR code you are trying to scan has been declared invalid. That's why you can't add it. Try to add a valid QR code, or contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk via 0800-1421 and give them the following error code.
errorQRValidateBlockedDCC.title: QR code has been declared invalid

errorQRValidateUnknownError.body: Try to add a valid QR code, or contact the CoronaCheck helpdesk via 0800-1421 and give them the following error code.
errorQRValidateUnknownError.title: Sorry, something went wrong

noDigiD.title: Continue without DigiD
noDigiD.description: If you can’t or don’t want to request a DigiD

withBSN.title: Yes, I have a BSN
withBSN.description: Get your certificate from the CoronaCheck helpdesk

noBSNWithVaccination.title: No, I don't have a BSN
noBSNWithVaccination.description: Get your certificate from the GGD

vaccinationLocationGGD.title: At the GGD
vaccinationLocationGGD.description: Arrange your certificate via the GGD

vaccinationLocationOther.title: At another healthcare provider
vaccinationLocationOther.description: Arrange your certificate via, for example, your GP or care facility

noBSNWithTest.title: No, I don't have a BSN
noBSNWithTest.description: Get your certificate from your healthcare provider
